name: aarjun
bio: Turning coffee into code and bugs into features!

top_projects.name: encryptify
top_projects.description: A simple and efficient utility for end-to-end encryption tasks

top_projects.name: mathlib
top_projects.description: A simple test Go library for basic arithmetic operations like addition and subtraction etc..

readme_content:
I am a Software Engineer from Kerala (God's own country).
I have a passion for coding and love to work on various projects that challenge my skills and help me learn new technologies.

arjunshajitech/encryptify.summary: Recent activities include multiple feature additions such as implementing examples for x3dh and ecdh-ed25519-aes, updating examples for simple aes and ecdh, and implementing aes-cbc encrypt/decrypt. Additionally, several updates were made to the repository, including changes to the README.md file and the implementation of basic ecdh and ed25519 key generation.

arjunshajitech/interceptor.summary: Recent activities include two fixes: adding a defer function to NewPacket and removing the release payload pool check. These changes demonstrate a focus on improving the reliability and performance of the repository.

arjunshajitech/ice.summary: Recent activities include two fixes aimed at reducing garbage collection pressure: optimizing ICE events and replacing the make function with sync.Pool for efficient memory reuse. These changes indicate an effort to enhance the repository's efficiency and performance.

pion/ice.summary: Recent activity includes a pull request to fix an issue by reducing GC pressure from frequent ICE gathering events, demonstrating a focus on optimizing performance and addressing specific problems within the repository.

profile_summary: I'm aarjun, a software engineer from Kerala, passionate about coding and building projects with Go, Python, and Java, with a track record of delivering quality solutions as evident from my 44 public repositories. I enjoy turning ideas into features and continually look for opportunities to learn and grow, fueled by my passion for coding and a good cup of coffee. With a growing network of peers and a commitment to collaborative development, I'm excited to contribute to and learn from the open-source community.
